# The `BinaryStreamRef` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystreamref">BinaryStreamRef</a> is to <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystream">BinaryStream</a> what <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a> is to an Array. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystreamref">BinaryStreamRef</a> is to <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystream">BinaryStream</a> what <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a> is to an Array.

It provides copy-semantics and read only access to a &quot;window&quot; of the underlying <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystream">BinaryStream</a>. Note that <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystreamref">BinaryStreamRef</a> is <em>not</em> a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystream">BinaryStream</a>. That is to say, it does not inherit and override the methods of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystream">BinaryStream</a>. In general, you should not pass around pointers or references to BinaryStreams and use inheritance to achieve polymorphism. Instead, you should pass around BinaryStreamRefs by value and achieve polymorphism that way.

Definition at line 153 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamref-h">BinaryStreamRef.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### readBytes() {#ad588b860f21801af78f6623f679c94ae}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Error BinaryStreamRef::readBytes (uint64&#95;t Offset, uint64&#95;t Size, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; uint8&#95;t &gt; &amp; Buffer) const</>}>
Given an Offset into this StreamRef and a Size, return a reference to a buffer owned by the stream.

<SectionUser title="Returns">
a success error code if the entire range of data is within the bounds of this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystreamref">BinaryStreamRef</a>&#39;s view and the implementation could read the data, and an appropriate error code otherwise.
</SectionUser>

Given an Offset into this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystreamref">BinaryStreamRef</a>, return a reference to the largest buffer the stream could support without necessitating a copy.
